comments.html: Service providers are complaining that customers are beginning to actually consume what was advertised and what they have been paying for. In response, ISPs need to either better invest in their infrastructure to support the services they have promised, or advertise more realistic speeds (e.g. 20 Mbps burst with a CIR of only 2 Mbps). It's that simple. Transfer caps are merely an *additional,* unnecessary restriction on what is already a policed service.
